result.execSummary:
The defendant Tod R Hornada was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: May transfer probation to Washington County.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tod R Hornada

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated

Notice of Court Ordered Financial Obligations Status
Discharge date: 07/20/16
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Voss.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Tod R Hornada in court with Attorney Thomas K. Voss.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Konrad Paczuski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Voss makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:     WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR     **May be transferred to Washington County** 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Defendant Tod R Hornada in court with Attorney Thomas K. Voss.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Voss requests an adjournment.  Court adjourns.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Atty Voss has been appointed. (Contract) Defendant to pay: $50 per month commencing on 05/01/15.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tod R Hornada in court.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he did not qualify for public defender representation and requests a court appointed attorney.  Court reviews petition and grants Defendant's request.  Court orders an attorney bew appointed for Defendant and he is to pay for such attorney at rate of $50.00 per month, commencing 5/1/15 until paid in full.   Court sets a review date.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Tod R Hornada in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.
